page.title: 18Local History. The Castle
page.content: The castle has been run by government departments since 1953,previously privately owned.11 people are employed at the Castle.The head custodian has been working there for 9 years.It is busy,but enjoyable work and she is proud of her job.It is Britain's first stone built Norman castle,dating back to 1067.Every year approx. 5,000 people visit the castle, mostly in the summer months.This summer one of the scenes from Robin of Sherwood was filmed at the castle.The custodian said that everything looked spectacular and she enjoyed every minute of it,although she didn't get a part.She believes that the castle is Chepstow's history and without it Chepstow would be a dead town with no places of interest.
